page.title: 04Heavy Horses At Home Farm
page.content: Mr. Posnett of Home Farm, Norley breeds heavy horses. He breeds Shire horses and Clydesdales. He began the business approximately 12 years ago when he finished with his dairy herd, and is one of the countries heavy horse enthusiasts. He has 8 Shires and the same number of Clydesdales. In addition he has a hunter and its foal. He specializes in showing and breeding his heavy horses, and tells us that the big feet are a sign of good quality in these horses. The head of the Clydesdale is broader than that of the Shire, and also has broader 'pancake feet'. Mr. Posnett exports some of his heavy horses, usually by air from London or Prestwick to South Africa, Canada and America.
